net.casper.data.model

Class CDataCacheContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.casper.data.model.CDataCacheContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class CDataCacheContainer
extends Object
implements Serializable
    The cache container serves as the implementation container class for 2-D data caches. Provides structural, behavioral, and filtering functionalities on a variable-sized dataset cache. Note, this is a thread-safe container, which allows for concurrent modification. However, it does sacrifice accuracy on reads if there are high rates of additions and removals from the cache. This implementation decision was made on the basis of a high-volume read, low-volume write assumption.

    Rows are indexed by primary key. Primary keys should be designated with caution, as duplicates will cause silent overwrites of existing rows in the cache container. The data row map should be initializable with any type of concrete Map implementation (this will accommodate distributed caching services or products)

    Major Components

    1. Structural information (meta-data): Column names, Types, Primary key configurations
    2. Structural modifiers: indices on data rows (for performance optimization)
    3. Data store: stores references to rows of data, keyed by each data row's primary key
    4. Data manipulation: add / remove data from grid.
    5. Data actions: filtering (searching). Different types of filters can be accepted in the future.

    Since:
    v1.0
    Version:
    $Revision: 125 $
    Author:
    Jonathan Liang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • CDataCacheContainer

        public CDataCacheContainer(String cacheName,
                   CRowMetaData metaData)
                    throws CDataGridException
        Creates an instance of a cache container. In this case, the underlying map storage implementation will be java.util.HashMap.
        Parameters:
        cacheName - - name of cache
        metaData - - the meta definition
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • CDataCacheContainer

        public CDataCacheContainer(String cacheName,
                   CRowMetaData metaData,
                   Map dataRowMap)
                    throws CDataGridException
        Creates an instance of this cache container Note that, ultimately, the underlying map implementation is passed in. This will allow the dynamic swap-in of cache implementations (or existing cached objects)
        Parameters:
        cacheName - - name of cache
        metaData - - meta data object describing the cache's configuration
        dataRowMap - - the concrete implementation
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • CDataCacheContainer

        public CDataCacheContainer(String cacheName,
                   String columnNames,
                   Class[] columnTypes,
                   String primaryKeys)
                    throws CDataGridException
        Convenience method for construction of a CDataCacheContainer. Uses a HashMap for data row storage.
        Parameters:
        cacheName - of cache
        columnNames - column names. Multiple columns are separated by commas, eg: "firstname,lastname" (NB: do not include a space after the comma).
        columnTypes - column types
        primaryKeys - primary key. Multiple columns are separated by commas, eg: "firstname,lastname" (NB: do not include a space after the comma).
        Throws:
        CDataGridException - if problem during construction.

      • get

        public CDataRowSet get(String columnName,
              Object[] values,
              String[] sortColumnNames,
              boolean ascending)
                throws CDataGridException
        Returns a collection of data objects. This overloaded method makes it easier for a user to perform a multi-value match using equality-based matching. This method merely constructs an equality-based filter into a filter clause to perform the general search on records in this cache.
        Parameters:
        columnName - - column to perform match on
        values - - values to match
        sortColumnNames - - names of columns to sort data by
        ascending - - true, to return in ascending order; false to reverse
        Returns:
        CDataRowSet - rowset of all matching rows
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • get

        filterClause -
        Returns:
        rowset of matching rows
        Throws:

      • get

        public CDataRowSet get(CDataFilterClause filterClause,
              String[] sortColumnNames,
              boolean ascending)
                throws CDataGridException
        Returns all rows from the cache which match the filters provided. Checks if there exists an index on the column. Match according to passed multi-values. Then sorts data matches.
        Parameters:
        columnName -
        filters -
        sortColumnName -
        ascending -
        Returns:
        collection of all matching rows in the cache
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • addData

        public int addData(CDataCacheContainer dataContainer,
          boolean updateIndices)
            throws CDataGridException
        Adds rows (union operation) from a data container into the current data container. Note, the meta definitions will be validated before the containers can be unioned in order to avoid corruption of data in the container.
        Parameters:
        dataContainer -
        updateIndices -
        Returns:
        number of rows added
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • addData

        public int addData(CDataRow[] dataRows)
            throws CDataGridException
        Adds a whole set of data to the data cache (union operation). Because we add data as well as rebuild the indices (by default) It will be considered inefficient to call this method repeatedly.
        Parameters:
        dataRows - - rows to add to container
        Returns:
        number of rows added
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • addSingleRow

        public void addSingleRow(Object[] oRow)
                  throws CDataGridException
        Convenience method to add a single row of data. After calling this, particularly if called repeatedly, call updateIndices().
        Parameters:
        row - raw data row
        Throws:
        CDataGridException - if problem adding the row

      • addData

        public int addData(CDataRow[] dataRows,
          boolean updateIndices)
            throws CDataGridException
        Add all data rows to the grid (union operation). The option of updating the indices is provided as an option here as an outlet to save on performance, (since the indices have to be rebuilt).
        Parameters:
        dataRows - - rows of data to add to cache.
        updateIndices - - true, to automatically rebuild any configured indices
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • removeData

        public int removeData(String columnName,
             Object[] values,
             boolean updateIndices)
               throws CDataGridException
        Removes all data rows matching the values provided There are two cases for removal: (1) column index is the same as that of the primary key column :: simple removal (this can only be the case if there is a single PK column (no composite keys)) (2) brute-force scan :: no alternative here, so we need to scan once through the dataset
        Parameters:
        columnName - - column name to perform removal matches on
        values - - matching values to remove from container
        updateIndices - - true, to automatically update any configured indices
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • removeData

        public int removeData(CDataFilterClause filterClause,
             boolean updateIndices)
               throws CDataGridException
        Removes all records which match the filter clause provided.
        Parameters:
        filterClause -
        updateIndices -
        Returns:
        number of row removed
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • removeAll

        public int removeAll()
              throws CDataGridException
        "Remove-all" effectively wipes out the data underlying the cache. We can't just replace the dataMap with a new map, because the persistent store will still maintain reference to the data. We need to retreive the keyset and remove every entry, one-by-one
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • merge

        public int merge(CDataCacheContainer mergeFrom,
        String[] joinColumns)
          throws CDataGridException
        Merges another data container into the current data container. There are the following limitations to the merge operation: (1) Both data containers must have the same primary key (2) Only the data columns that exist in both the destination container (current) and the source container ("mergeFrom") will exist in the
        Parameters:
        mergeFrom - - CDataCacheContainer to merge into current container
        joinColumns - - columns to join by
        Returns:
        number rows merged
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • merge

        public int merge(CDataRowSet mergeFrom,
        String[] joinColumns)
          throws CDataGridException
        Merges a rowset into the current data container
        Parameters:
        mergeFrom - - the rowset to merge from
        mergeColumn - - the column to join on
        Returns:
        number of rows updated
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

        public void addUniqueIndex(String columnName)
                    throws CDataGridException
        Adds a unique index to the data cache (this should only be done once in the lifetime of the cache, per column)
        Parameters:
        columnName - - the name of the column to add an index on
        Throws:

        Columns with indices.

      • updateIndices

        public void updateIndices()
                   throws CDataGridException
        This method is called after data has been added or removed from the cache. This method effectively rebuilds all configured indices in the cache container.
        Throws:
        CDataGridException
